properties.name: First United
properties.schedule: Monday, Wednesday, Friday: 9:00-11:00 AM. Tuesday, Thursday: 12:30-2:30 PM
properties.note: Capacity is limited, so please arrive at the start of the intake period. Please bring along any paperwork you have related to your issue.

properties.name: Kettle Friends Society
properties.note: No appointment is needed as our service is available on a drop-in basis.  Our office is on the second floor of 1725 Venables Street and is wheelchair accessible.

properties.name: Wilson Heights United Church Advocacy Program
ATIRA Women's Advocacy
properties.note: The Legal Advocacy Program is for low-income women (inclusive of transwomen) in the Downtown Eastside to obtain free legal advocacy in a safe and confidential, women’s only space.

properties.name: AIDS Vancouver Case Management
properties.note: You can drop in to our Office at 803 East Hasting Street between the hours of 10:00am and 4:00pm, Monday through Friday. Call 604-893-2201 for more information.

properties.name: Downtown Eastside Women's Centre Drop-in
properties.schedule: Monday, Tuesday, Thursday & Friday from 10:00 am to 5:00 pm. Wednesday from 11:00 am to 5:00 pm. Saturday and Sunday and statutory Holidays from 12:00 pm to 5:00 pm
properties.note: Daily, the Centre offers a refuge for women and children in the Downtown Eastside of Vancouver.  We provide basic-needs, as well as counseling, advocacy, social, educational and referral services

fields.name: LSLAP Clinics
fields.schedule: Varies by location, please see website
fields.note: Please call for information on our availability.

fields.name: TRAC Tenant Resource & Advisory Centre
fields.schedule: TRAC provides free representation to tenants at dispute resolution hearings only in limited situations.
fields.address: Provides support and information online and over the phone
fields.note: Primarily online and phone based resource

fields.name: Battered Women Support Society
fields.note: The Legal Advocacy Program at BWSS provides support, advocacy, information and accompaniment to women who have experienced violence and who are involved in the legal system. For more information or to make an appointment, call or email legaladvocacy@bwss.org

fields.name: YWCA Legal Educator
fields.note: The YWCA legal educator provides one-to-one legal support and group workshops on a range of legal matters for women in need, including family law, poverty law, custody agreements, peace bonds and affidavits. *Please note: The legal educator is not a lawyer and does not offer legal advice, but offers education, resources, referrals and support around legal issues.

fields.name: Disability Alliance B.C
fields.phone: Phone: 604-872-1278 in the Lower Mainland. Toll Free: 1-800-663-1278
fields.note: We host legal clinics for people with disabilities who need legal advice on civil law issues. This is made possible through our community partner, Access Pro Bono Society. To find out more or schedule an appointment, contact Janis at 604-872-1278.

fields.name: Jewish Family Services
fields.note: If you are paying more than 30% of your monthly income on rent and your household income is below $35,000, you should make an appointment to see JFSA’s Housing Coordinator.

fields.name: MOSAIC Legal Advocacy Program
fields.note: MOSAIC’s Legal Advocacy Program provides information, summary advice, referrals and legal representation to low-income immigrants and refugees. We help newcomers navigate the Canadian legal system, ensuring that they are informed of their legal rights and responsibilities. All advocacy services are provided free of charge to eligible individuals.

fields.name: Multicultural Helping Housing
fields.schedule: Open Monday to Saturday from 9:00 am - 5:00 pm, lunch break from 12:30 pm - 1:30 pm
fields.note: MOSAIC’s Legal Advocacy Program provides information, summary advice, referrals and legal representation to low-income immigrants and refugees. We help newcomers navigate the Canadian legal system, ensuring that they are informed of their legal rights and responsibilities. All advocacy services are provided free of charge to eligible individuals.
